My husband and I came here for brunch on abuts Saturday. We waited thirty minutes to be seated but were happy to stand under the electric heartens outdoors prior to being seated inside.   I ordered a mimosa because my husband had and his was mostly champagne with a splash of orange juice. I was a little saddened to see that mine had a more generous pour of orange juice, but I'm guessing a different bartender may have made my drink.   I had a bowl of the she-crab soup for the first time and wow!! So delicious, rich and creamy. I want more just thinking about it. I also ordered a make your own three egg omelette but was disappointed because I paid an upcharge to have avocado in it and it was served on top and had browned. I know how quickly avocado can brown, however paying $2 for a few slices I expect it to be in prime shape.   The omelette was fine and the bacon was alright too. A little undercooked maybe and maybe a bit more salty than usual, but served quickly and generous portions which tasted good.   My husband ordered the fried chicken and biscuits with sausage gravy. He devoured the whole meal and said it was excellent. I tried a bite and thought the chicken was cooked perfectly.   We will definitely be back! One star off for avocado omelette issues. Hopefully we go at a non-peak time for our next visit and these flaws will be fixed.
Some of the best French Toast in town. Lots of other good breakfast food as well.  This was my first visit.

I would like to give this place 4 1/2 stars (I very seldom give five stars).  While this is not fine dining it is a place to get good food, at a reasonable price with good service.  If possible get there early as they tend to be busy during the rush times.  It has a clean, unpretentious atmosphere.  The food is fresh and things are done in a timely manner.
Yes it's true, 4 stars for a diner!! Probably the best in town. Consistently delicious, good consistent service. Try the ribs. Off menu items available, just ask, they'll make it.

I totally get it!  This is a charlotte staple and I see why.... we'll I'm not sure if it is a staple( made that up)  but eddies place most certainly should be!   I came for brunch with friends and stayed for the drinks.   At 12pm sharp the crowd started cheering.  Let the drink service begin!  It was a Bloody Mary kind of day and I'm so glad it was... their bloody Mary's are perfectly spicy salty and strong! The food. MMMMMM! Fried chicken biscuit and gravy!!! Yes a thousand times yes! And that's all you really need to know about the food! Well ok a lot of other great things on the menu.  My hubs had the chicken and waffles which were all type of perfection and our friend had the chicken fried prime rib and breakfast burritos which I didn't try. The ambiance isn't anything fancy but it ways I can't explain, adds to the charm.  The sassy hostess was adorable and the service was great!  Price points aren't too bad  So much for my new year resolution diet!  But Eddies Place was worth it!

This is simple. Very good food. Good service. And you have to have the She Crab soup. You must. It has to be one of the very best I've had anywhere. And I've had some over the years. And while I don't really like Ranch dressing theirs is the best. Questions?

Solid breakfast spot! The service was quick and efficient! I got the corned beef eggs and hash. The corned beef hash was more like hash browns with corned beef thrown in, it was good but not a favorite by any means. I'm giving them four stars mostly because I couldn't stop eating my breakfast partner's chicken and biscuits. Ummm wow, something I would never think to order, but it was effing delicious. The chicken was seasoned well, the sausage gravy was awesome, and the biscuit was really the perfect icing on the cake so to speak. If I went back I would order that and plan not to eat for the rest of the day!

Sunday breakfast is my hands-down favorite meal of the week, and I generally feel like it's a pretty difficult meal to mess up.  Eddie's Place has proved me wrong!  We showed up around 8:45 on a Sunday morning, and there were only 5 or 6 tables full.  We were quickly seated... and then slowly waited on; it had gotten to the point where the fella was starting to count down the minutes til we walked out because no one had been by our table.  Yikes.  Finally, our waitress appeared.  I ordered a basic breakfast - two scrambled egg whites, bacon, hash browns and toast for $7.50 - and the fella ordered one of the specials - a pulled pork benedict with cheese grits and cornbread for $10.  The food came out quickly, and about halfway through our meal, we asked the other how the meal was.  Both of us replied with "just ok."  My bacon was charred, and my hash browns were bland and rubbery.  The toast and eggs were fine.  His grits were a cheesy stew with no grit consistency, and the eggs and corn bread were fine.  Oddly enough, the pulled pork was the worst part of the pulled pork benedict.  There just wasn't much taste or seasoning to anything we ate.  It had been probably 9 years since I'd visited Eddie's Place, and that was for lunch, but I had a much fonder memory of their food and service than what I actually experienced today.  Bummer.
Always the best of everything. Sit at the bar and ask for Jesse. Great guy and lots of good cheer. Fantastic cobbler and steak.

Went for Sunday morning breakfast.  Got the crab cake benedict special.  Honestly the crab cakes were just ok; had a little shell in it.  It was served on a biscuit, but I think I prefer an English Muffin.  The parmesan cheese grits were the best part of the meal . . . very rich & savory.  SERVICE (1 star): Regarding my waitress, once she brought out my food, she never checked on me again.  Didn't ask how the food was, didn't check on my drinks, etc.  When she returned my credit card slip to pay, she said "Here you go."  I replied "thank you" and she didn't say anything else.  I've been in customer service industries my entire career.  I thought you thanked the CUSTOMER for their business . . . otherwise, you wouldn't have a job or any business.  Needless to say, disappointed with the service here!

Chicken and waffles with hash brown. I think I'm in love, "who is Roscoe's" is what you'll be saying after you've finished your plate (yes you will eat it all) . If your visiting North Carolina this is a must. Great atmosphere and super friendly staff. Thank you guys

6/6/17 Brought my daughter here after her graduation. The salmon special was excellent. My husband's steak was cooked as he wanted. My daughter's cajun pasta was delicious. The cup of clam chowder was on point. Our server was attentive the whole time. Everything was cooked very well. It has been a while since the food has come out with no issues.    9/26/16 I have a love-hate dining relationship with this place.     5 months ago Visited on a Saturday around noon for a late breakfast. Seems like there are new waitresses. Ours was a aloof and never asked to refill my coffee. That is a first. Service here is usually excellent. And no, it was not busy at all.  I ordered the steak and eggs. My daughter had the waffles. My son had a basic egg and bacon breakfast. Everything we usually order when we visit.   The steak was absolute rubber...throw in the slimy fat and it was just horrible. Country potatoes were like pebbles. Biscuit was dry. My daughter said the waffles tasted different...lacking that buttermilk fluff with slight crisp taste. My son barely ate his food just because he is difficult like that...but he always eats the bacon. Not this time.  He said it was too salty and soft. I tried a piece and it was.  We usually leave here very satisfied but this visit left me disappointed and hungry. New cooks? Lower quality of food? New management? Who knows!

Great low key Cotswold neighborhood hangout that's been around since 1997.  I enjoy it mostly for breakfast but it's actually a New Orleans style restaurant.  I hear the burgers are great too!  Comfort food, reasonable prices, friendly service and neighborhood atmosphere...can't go wrong with that!  AND...locally owned and operated!!!  :)

I am so confused! I attempted to make a to go order at 11:33pm and was told they don't do to go orders after 10pm. I am not sure how this business practice makes any sense. You have to cook the food if I eat it here or if I take it to go. If I eat it here and don't finish it, it will then be to go. I am just confused!

I love the atmosphere in this place. Rustic yet slightly chic with a comfort food menu. I love she crab soup and was told it was the best anywhere. Of course I had to try it. Well maybe I shouldn't have added the splash of sherry because it made the soup taste sweet. To be fair, next time I will try it first minus the sherry to see if that was the culprit. Other than that, everything else we ordered was excellent.

People need to stop finding out about this place. We used to come here all the time when we lived in the area and came back on Saturday morning around 8:30 and it was already packed. We usually prefer to sit at the bar because the bartender is awesome. If you have the chance, sit there! We were seated in the only open spot which was right behind the hostess table. First off it was freeeezing. The service was painfully slow. I never saw our waitress and the place looked understaffed. The hostess was not very organized and a bunch of old guys stood awkwardly close to us waiting for their tables and kept telling the hostess about empty tables. The coffee is always good, and my hash browns this time were very undercooked. This experience was 1-2 stars but for old time's sake I'm leaving 3.

For my first visit, this place was great!  I had the waffle breakfast and it was served with a honey-cinnamon butter that's made on site. Very delicious and affordable!  The service was fantastic and everyone was very friendly.  This place has become my new spot for breakfast!

Stumbled on this restaurant by accident, but returned multiple times because of the great food and service! The first night I had the Cajun Chicken and my friend had the Seafood Combination. On the first bite, all we could say was yum. We found out they had breakfast and returned for the Eggs Benedict and Bloody Mary. The cheese grits were phenomenal and the livermush, a southern favorite was nice and crispy. While we were there we chatted with the regulars and found out it was a neighborhood hang out. I think their neighborhood just got larger because I will have to go back many more times!

Did a check in while I was there. But they def deserve a full review.   First time here. Absolutely loved it. I'm known for hardly eating my food. I always have to take a box to go. But not this time, I ate it all. It was a lunch portion but it was quite a bit of food. I got the chicken parm and it was so good. I also had their salad before my meal and that was good too.   Surprised I never saw this place or heard about it before. A fellow nurse brought me here on our way to South Park and I'm so glad she did.   The service was great and the restaurant decor was decent(causal dining). It was very cold inside(maybe because we were seated by the window) but other than that no complaints. The booth was pretty large.   Parked right out front. Food came out in about 15-20 minutes. Server came to check on us quite frequently until it was time to pay lol. He was very busy though. We went to the register to pay.   Def will go back. Next time I'll try something different. My friend got country fried something and grits I think. She wanted something else but they told her it was only served on special occasions or a certain day(not sure). However, she enjoyed what she ordered as well. Def would go back if I'm in the area.

In a few words, the food was worth the wait.  I came here for brunch this weekend.  It was a 20-25min wait around 10:00am.  They don't do call-aheads, so you just have to wait it out.  Our name was called...time to eat!  We sat down and were immediately greeted by our waiter.  We were in the very back of the restaurant at the end of the bar near the kitchen, where it was surprising quiet.  With Food Network playing in the back and people watching in the front, there was plenty of great views from that area.  There is nothing special or fancy about this place...just your standard restaurant decor.  Service was super slow, from getting coffee refills to actually getting our food.  They were busy, so I wasn't expecting service to fly.  The food finally came and it was pretty darn good.  I got a basic breakfast.  Scrambled eggs, ham, hashbrowns and a biscuit.  Everything tasted as you would expect.  We also got the country breakfast with fried chicken/gravy on top of a biscuit.  If I wasn't trying to watch my diet, I would literally order that meal every day.  Gravy: A+.  Fried Chicken: A.  Biscuit: A.  Mimosas and Bloody Mary's are $5 each and come in a wine glass and pint glass.  Tip: They won't seat you until your full party is there!  Also, the bar is first-come, first-serve in case the wait for a table is too long.  Overall, great brunch food.  I feel like I finally found my brunch fix in Charlotte.  I look forward to eating through the brunch menu because it just looked that good.

If I lived in Charlotte, this would be one of my go-to spots. It's a perfect place for Happy Hour or even weekend brunch. It does get crowded though so there may be a little bit of a wait. Fortunately, the bar was open when I went. The staff is pretty awesome, and they were accommodating when my friend and I changed our orders last minute after seeing someone else get their waffle chicken sandwiches. There needs to be more places like this in the world!

Needed a quick eggs and grits breakfast on a busy Sunday morning and got it! Service was great and the atmosphere was all families and friends. Every table and booth was full when I left at 9:30am. Coffee was hot and strong, grits were perfect and I was able to make it to my grandson's baptism on time. Noise level was a bit on the "loud background" level due to a large turned-on TV mounted at ceiling height about 15 ft. from my table but since I was dining alone it didn't matter. I'll be back for lunch and breakfast whenever I'm in Charlotte.
Always great to be at Eddie's. Never had a bad meal here. Fried Pickles, Chicken Salad, Chef Salad, or even breakfast.... it's always good!

You'd never know by the outside that this the best brunch in Charlotte. The chicken and waffles are amazingly delicious, cheese grits needed salt but are fabulous. $5 mimosas and bloodies hit the spot. Not bad of a wait, definitely worth it.

Finally found our diner. Breakfast is served all day and they have a fair number of fried seafood on the menu. My husband and I came here half crazed with hunger from hiking all day so naturally we ordered the saltiest greasiest thing on the menu. I had the country fried breakfast with hash browns. Now, I suggest looking at the photos of the country fried breakfast and preface this by saying I weigh a buck twenty. It was so good, I ate the whole dang thing! I usually have my meals cut in half but after the first bite gluttony won out. I suggest it hands down.

My husband and I checked out Eddie's place for breakfast on our short weekend trip to Charlotte. We had no wait which was awesome. The Ciabbata French toast was good, the pancakes were excellent and the Chicken and Waffles were the best we've ever had. The Bloody Mary was pretty delicious as well. Our waitress, Ginger, was attentive and incredibly helpful in providing us with recommendations for places to check out in Charlotte. We definitely recommend this as a brunch location!!

Thanks to Yelp, we came across this place for breakfast and had to give a try. It truly didn't disappoint at all. The service was quick, the food was adequate without being overly large. Great family place and seems very popular with the locals. I think when we come back to the area, we will go again.

As a native of this city I'm somewhat ashamed to admit I've just now eaten here.  Better late than never though!    What a gem.  Sure, its parking lot can sometimes be a landmine, sure it's not the newest shiniest gemstone of a dining establishment and you know what?  I'm good with all that because I just had probably the best Rueben I've ever had alongside some of the best hand cut fries.    Top off the delicious food with a dose of pleasant table side manner and viola!  Achievement unlocked!    It might be called Eddie's Place but now it's My Place.  That's right My Place (I'll concede my naming rights with a handshake from Eddie himself only).
Definite brunch/breakfast spot. Gotta try their chicken and waffles. Its to die for!

First time here & family enjoyed the breakfast. Service was quick and waitress extremely helpful. Fiancé wasn't a fan of Parmesan grits, but waitress promptly noticed & provided him with regular grits. P.S. My daughter loved the Parmesan grits! Will return again for lunch.

As long as you know what you're signing up for, this place is great.  It's not fancy by any means but offers delicious food and pleasant service.    The She Crab soup is terrific and the bread that comes with it is incredible - it's served warm and is soft inside with the perfect amount of lightly crispy crust!  The Po Boys are served on the same bread (I suggest asking for a side of mayo and mixing the mayo with Tabasco and then adding it to your Po Boy).  Also notable are the pancakes - which are perfect - fluffy and tasty! Just make sure you don't miss the soup!
The Prime Rib on Tuesdays is amazing.  High quality food in a casual environment.  Great menu with a touch of creole.

Went here on a Sunday morning and parking is terrible. There were people waiting but turnover was quick. Selection was good but taste was mediocre maybe a bit more. Portions were good. I would eat here again in pinch but for a couple of dollars more Cafe Monte is a much better pick.

The service here is always great. They would keep refill your coffee. Great place for breakfast and they have lunch too. Breakfast is all day. Parking can be tricking. The best time to go is very early or during the late afternoon. I usually get the omlette. You choose the toppings you want on your omlette. Pancakes are good too come with a side and a choice of meat.

Went around 4:30 on a Saturday, was relatively busy but we were seated immediately. The decor was beautiful and fit the ambience of the place. The staff was friendly and spoke to us when we entered the establishment and left. Our waiter was amazing and had great recommendations for our taste. Can't wait to return to get another batch of the shrimp and grits! It was decadent!

The wife and I love going here. Breakfast is always good and the lunch items are tasty as well. Service is good. You can always tell a good place to eat when there is almost always a wait. They serve lunch and breakfast all day as well keeping everyone happy. You have got to try the biscuit and gravy!

I had a pretty standard breakfast and it was okay. Eggs, hash browns (fried potato cubes), ham and a lot of great rye toast. It's three stars because they were too busy for the amount of staff. Sitting at the bar and facing the kitchen, I saw quite a few plates sitting up there ready to go to tables for way too long. Including my own that was up for a good four minutes.  When they had time, the service was friendly and good but they needed at least one more person working the line this morning.

Had a friend take me here for brunch and you can tell it's a neighborhood favorite, be prepared to wait! We managed to get a seat at the bar after about 5 min and had good service and I enjoy the 'cheers' feel to the place. I had an egg sandwich and mimosa for brunch. Food took forever! Not sure if just backed up or if that's usual. And brunch wasn't bad, but nothing above average. But I plan to go again to try other items on the menu!

I have been here a couple of times for breakfast and I think Eddie's has some solid breakfast food.  First off, I have to say that I love their bacon.  It's a little frustrating that you only get two slices in an order, but it's reasonably thick and has this amazing smoky flavor.  Still, it's totally worth getting if you like a smokier bacon taste.  The other day, I ordered a special from there of orange and cream pancakes.  Basically, the cakes were covered in marmalade and came with a creamy sauce drizzled over them.  The creamy sauce was delicious, but it would have been nice to get a little more on the cakes.  Still, I really enjoyed it.  My partner absolutely loves their cheese grits.  They have a wonderful cheese flavor and less creamy than some grits you can get here in the QC.  They are not overly salty, which he appreciates.  Finally, their coffee is better than a lot of places.  I assume they don't use Cadillac coffee, which I definitely appreciate.  Eddie's may not have an extensive menu, but they do have some great specials when you come in there.  They also don't have giant portions, but I always think the amount of food is just right.  It is reasonably priced for Charlotte and I always feel like I'm getting good quality food for the price.  One of these days, I will make here to try their dinner menu.    Service has always been pretty good as well.  Our food has always come out very quickly, which I definitely appreciate it.  Last time we came, our server was a little slow to get to us, but she more than made up for that later.  Overall, I can honestly say I'm a fan of Eddie's so far and I look forward to trying out their dinner menu sometime.

Saturday brunch is the best!! Awesome service and excellent food. You'll probably have to wait to be seated but it is worth the wait.  Guys get a Man-mosa. Invented here and excellent way to get your Saturday going.

Yes to an amazing Sunday Brunch!  Finally had a chance to experience Eddie Place. The food was truely amazing. I ordered the Chicken and Waffles with hashbrowns. The chicken was cooked perfectly, juicy and not greasey. The cinnamon honey butter married the dish together. Everything was great. Service was good and the feel of the restaurant felt like home. Very good spot to try. I will have to make a trip back for dinner hours. ~Feliz comiendo~
Cheese grits - excellent, pancakes - excellent, eggs - eggcellent.  Love this place, great location, friendly staff, solid greasy spoon eating.
This used to be one of my favorite hangouts but it's not the same Eddies Place anymore. Sad

The food and service is great at Eddies Place!!! If you in the area this is a nice place to stop even if your on a budget.   I had the chicken and waffles with grits.  Everybody in my party had something different and loved their meals.  My server Kent was friendly and very helpful on the food choices.

Came in for a late lunch, not sure what to expect. Bartender (Jessie?) was awesome. Super friendly, with great knowledge of the menu and beer selection. Food came out relatively fast and the Muffalata sandwich was excellent.   Warning! The Muffalata is a MASSIVE sandwich. When given the option to get half or whole, get the half. I guarantee you wont even start the second half. But it is delicious, so dont be afraid to get it!

Another tucked away breakfast spot in the suburbs of Charlotte.  We have been here a couple of times and their breakfast is yummy yummy.  I recommend making an omelet!  Or the eggs Benedict is really tasty.  Everything tastes very fresh, their waitstaff are very polite and prompt.  There is a long wait on the weekends unless you get their at the right time, timing is everything with breakfast in Charlotte it seems.  Pretty good prices, a bit higher than say IHOP or Cracker Barrel but it is a local business so I'd rather put my money their.  Try it!

I'm a huge fan of Mom and Pop places. This one gets a solid 3.5 stars in my book. EXCELLENT and friendly service, homey atmosphere, lots of booths for seating, but the food was mediocre.  I felt a little out of place when I first walked in because this seems like a "locals-only" sort of establishment. Once the waitress came up with her super sunshiney attitude, my feelings were dismissed though.  Got the veggie burger with onion rings, things were cooked well but the only buns they had were made from white bread (super ick).  Methinks I'll try breakfast some time.

We had breakfast here recently and the Governor of North Carolina was eating there, which makes perfect sense: this place is just a good 'ol fashioned Charlotte-style breakfast joint. Nothing fancy, but great nonetheless.   Since it's not much to look at,  I was kinda surprised when I walked in on a Sunday to find Eddie's TOTALLY packed. Make note of that if you're coming here on a weekend.   As for the food itself, it was pretty good. Mostly offering standard breakfast options, Eddie's also has some more southern style foods like grits and biscuits n' gravy, both of which were ordered by my group and were deemed awesome. Great coffee and service, too.

This is a great local spot with a family atmosphere and the menu to back it up!  Let's start with their signature She-Crab Soup.  This is one of my favorite things to eat in Charlotte! It is absolutely delicious!  Even if you don't like soup...or crab, i guarantee you will like this. (Tip: put a little sprinkle of sherry in the bowl)   The rest of the menu is really solid with Sandwiches, burgers and signature dishes.  I usually go for the Turkey Pita if i want something light and pair it with a small bowl of She-Crab.  Also, they serve breakfast all day!  Tuesday night is $1.50 an ounce Prime Rib night (if you're feeling crazy ask them to deep fry it)

Alright, I know this place is a local legend. I want to give it a higher rating, I really do. But Eddie's place was a big "meh" in my book.  First of all, it's trying to accomplish wayyyyy to much. Is it a southern comfort place? A breakfast place? Eclectic American? Bar food? Deli? And why the shit are there potstickers on the menu?  As for the food, I ordered the shrimp and cheese grits, which were very good. Possibly the mildest grits I'd ever had. It came with a salad that was substantial and included bacon. So far, so good. Some friends ordered the she-crab soup, which was tasty, especially with a bit of sherry.  However, a friend ordered the potato skins, which were completely lacking for flavor. Couldn't taste cheese, potato, or even sour cream. Just grease and carbs. Another friend ordered the reuben. It did not look good: greasy, with far too little meat.  The service was friendly, but bumbling. First, the potato skins came out as potstickers. Strike one. Then they added $1.50 to my tab because I asked for spinach in my salad. Seriously? First of all, spinach is not that fucking expensive. And secondly, you couldn't even put that in the fucking menu? Or explain to me that it cost extra? I call bullshit. Bullshit x1000.  Prices were high for the food they were serving. Needed to be about 20% less.  The place loaded up with people as we finished our meal, so we got out of there quickly to make way for the next party. I wanted to shake some of them on the way out and shout, "Why are you wasting your money here?! Go someplace where you can get consistent food with competent waitstaff!"  So, I dunno. Not my cup of tea. Maybe if you can stand dumb servers and you can distinguish between what is good and what isn't on the menu, you'll have a better time.
I got the fluffy pancakes and hashbrowns and cheese grits as my two sides. It was okay - food arrived quickly and the service was good.

I absolutely love Eddie's Place any time of the day, week or year! Everything I've tried has been amazing. Today I tried the chicken and waffles and OMG.. it was all I thought it would be and more. The Parmesan Grits are my favorite side option. But there is something for everyone here.

I finally got to try Eddie's Place.  It's a lot less busy on a Sunday night for dinner.  So I'll keep that in mind for next time.  It's a bit dark in here with the red walls and this probably makes it feel smaller than it really is but the chairs and booths are confortable.    The menu has several options with a Louisiana flair but they also serve breakfast all day which is a plus.    I ordered the cajun pasta which came with a side salad.  The salad was a bit disappointing.  It was iceberg lettuce, 2 tomatoes, 2 big slices of carrot.  Iceberg lettuce is just a real turnoff to me.  There are better greens to make a good salad.  The saving point was the habanero ranch dressing which had a wonderful kick to it!  The Cajun pasta was good.  The chicken was nicely spiced and it also came with andouille sausage.  The bread that accompanied the meal tasted like it was homemade.   I think this experience is more of a 3.5 rating but I didn't think they were worth the 4 yet.  I definitely need to come back and try the breakfasts.  I hear they are the bomb here.

Chicken and waffles are a must, and don't forget to order their Mac and cheese (insanely good). AND!! don't miss first call on Sunday at 12pm... The bartender (Ben) is a character in the best way possible and is very attentive. You're lucky if you get a seat at the bar! And the mimosas! They pour an entire mini bottle of champagne in the glass, add a splash of OJ, and then drop in a cherry.  If you want great service and delicious food, go to Eddie's.   PS - They serve breakfast all day

"Tom, you gotta go to Eddie's place!  OMG, Tom, it's awesome!"  I heard this non stop from not only my sister, but from my mother.  "We need to go soon, before there is an hour wait!!"  OK!  Shit!!!    After our Black Friday shopping was done, we decided to go to Eddie's (as I would be leaving to go to Wilmington shortly after) for brunch.  It seems like everyone must have still been shopping, because when we got there, we were able to be seated immediately.    One thing I noticed- I was shocked at how this place is a bar and a breakfast place as well.  And it has been open for 15 years.  They must be doing something right (as you sometimes hear about a lot of places that go out of business due to the fact they have an identity crisis, and lose tons of $$$)!    They had a normal menu, and a special brunch menu.  I can't even remember what I had, except I do remember dousing hot sauce on some hash browns.  I know I posted photos- and I am sure you will be able to tell which one I ate (it's clearly the unhealthiest out of the 3 pics).    I remember the food being seasoned well and coming out fairly quickly, considering it started to get busier as the day progressed.  I was saddened though they did serve PEPSI (yuck).    This place is definitely a solid place for breakfast, and after seeing the prices on some of their beers, I would have to come back and see what that's all about!
Good burger and good onion rings.  nice sized bar. friendly staff.

Found this place on Yelp. Reviews were good thought I'd give it a shot. Plus the wait at midnight diner was ridiculous as usual. The cheese grits are delish and so is the biscuit. Basically coffee and breakfast was awesome and price was decent for the area. Totally coming back.

Oh how I love a good breakfast place close to my house for those weekend mornings when I just want some delicious food without the hassle of making it and cleaning up. And Eddie's definitely fits that criteria; conveniently located in Cotswold, their breakfast is solid every time. We've been to Eddie's quite a bit, and tend to hit it up at least once on weekends when we have quests in town.   If you're going to try to go during peak breakfast hours on the weekend, be ready for a wait as they offer $4.00 mimosas and bloody mary's (made with zing zang, which is the best bloody mary mix available). The tables turn pretty quickly, but the place just isn't that big. Service is generally very good, and we've never had to ask for drink refills.   Eddie's generally has pretty good breakfast specials, and if you like coffee, it's a-ok. The omelets, french toast and pancakes are all very good. And they offer turkey sausage and great hash browns to round out your breakfast experience.   If you're in the area, give Eddie's a try!

We have only ever been here for breakfast, but it is always excellent!  The service is always attentive and friendly (Jesse is awesome, BTW) and the food is always delicious! We especially love their Home Fries.  Prices are reasonable, too.

REALLY??  The brunch here is awful!  so basic that I can't even believe what they charge...  when you choose ham as your meat, you get 1/2 of a slice of ham??!??  JEEZE!!  I ordered scrambled eggs with cheese...  there was zero cheese in there so I got plain scrambled eggs, 1/2 piece of ham, dry toast and over ripe tomatoes for $9.00?    My friend had never been there before and was super pissed to get a $16 bill for the uber-salty country fried chicken with biscuits and sausage gravy.  He asked for extra gravy and was outraged when he found an additional charge for it on his bill.  I was actually embarrassed to have suggested Eddie's to him, and trust me...  I won't make that mistake again...  I simply won't be back.

Came here for breakfast while in town visiting family. This place was awesome. I had the cibiatta french toast with smoked sausage and the wife had chicken and waffles. Great food and service. Highly recommend.

The next stop on my Reuben adventure took me to Eddie's Place, somewhere I didn't even know existed until I found them on yelp searching for Reubens. The place was a decent spot and the service was good.   The Reuben was fairly average - standard ingredients well proportioned with a very good amount of tasty Swiss. But nothing else about the Reuben stood out - average corned beef, buttery rye bread, and sour kraut from a can (or bag). Which doesn't mean it's a bad reuben, just didn't stand out from the many others I've had around the city. Overall it was an enjoyable sandwich and I'd have no issue eating another, but it's not a place I'd plan a trip for specifically for a Reuben.

This is a casual, classic charlotte restaurant that is consistently good!  They have breakfast all day, awesome specials during the week (umm prime rib Tuesdays), and salads that are so tasty and pretty that you actually want to finish the whole thing.  The dressings are homemade which is an added bonus.  My go-to is the Cobb salad.  Brunch here is really popular so expect to wait, but I promise ya it's worth it!  You can always get a drink at the bar while waiting.

I've been to Eddies a number of times over the years, and consistently forget to write about them - or even that I've been. I'm not sure if that means that they are not memorable or that they have just become so ingrained in my mind that I forget. Whatever the case, time to rectify the situation.  The good: Open for breakfast, and they serve up some interesting options, which means you may actually have to look at the menu to figure out what you want. Unfortunately this also means that they can get busy at breakfast, so you can have to wait.  The bad: The service can get a bit slow at times, though you can mitigate that a bit by going at a slightly off-time rather than a popular dining time. Unfortunately it only happens sometimes - at other times, it seems that the off hours dining is when the servers take their breaks, so it hits you too. On the plus side, it can make for a relaxing meal, and the food itself is generally tasty.

Simply the best value, best food and best atmosphere ever!  I have been going to this restaurant for over 15 years, and it just seems to keep on improving.  The dinner specials are amazing -- where else can you find FRESH grilled fish with 2 vegetables and a salad for under $20.  Want an awesome omelette for dinner, or pancakes, no problem.  The staff is laid back yet really attentive to what's important.  Don't be surprised to see the same people there over and over again.....it is truly a community gem.

First time ever, the ambiance is chill and casual.  I ordered the Pecan Crusted Chicken and Waffles with a side of Bacon Gouda Mac 'n Cheese. The best in the Queen City!!!  The waiter was attentive and gave great suggestions for a Eddie's Place newbie. Oh don't forget the Mimosa special on Sunday (pictured in the background)

I haven't dined in yet, but I ordered the She Crab Soup to go. I love She Crab so when I had a taste for it I did EXTENSIVE research on where I should go.  I googled and yelped "best She Crab soup charlotte, NC" and finally came to a series of reviews for Eddie's Place. Needless to say, I was sold. I ordered TWO bowls to go and drove 20 minutes to get them.  It is by far some of the best I have had in NC! (SC has some great ones of course) it was creamy with nice-sized chunks of crab meat and without a super fishy smell. Well worth the price and drive!  Side note: the staff was very welcoming and friendly!  You're welcome.
I will suggest the parmesean cheese grits.. Its not.on the menu but it will BLOW YOUR MIND... as will everything else on the menu.. A Charlottean classic.

I have been going to Eddie's since 2006 when I was wondering what it was. Well I am glad I did. They have some of the best breakfast in Charlotte. I love most of the nightly specials they do. They get great desserts from a local bakery (forgot the name) I love how it is in a great location.   Parking can be kinda tricky with Leroy Fox next door though.
Coffee was decent. Friendly service and generous portions. Try the breakfast burrito. Keep up the good work! Will definitely go back if I'm in the area again. I was told that it's calmer after 2:00.
One must try the she crab soup at Eddie's place. Coming from Boston, I think it's as heavenly as the best lobster bisque up north. The wait was long, but totally worth it.

While visiting friends of ours in Charlotte we found Eddies nearby and decided to give it a spin.  I agree with the 4.5 review average that they seem to be getting.  They are a straight up honest sandwich and breakfast place with friendly and quirky service.  We enjoyed our first visit and it absolutely earned a second.  My tuna salad exceeded my expectations and the Philly Cheesesteak was acceptable as well.  Wait staff was fast and attentive on both visits and I like local places even if they are small chains versus someplace like Panera.
Great varieties of beer!! The staff makes you feel like a regular, even on your first visit! Unpretentious food that delivers on great flavors. With the prices affordable enough to visit frequently.

Service was awful. Waiter wasn't friendly and only came by to drop off drinks and food....did not check to see if we needed anything. There was a gnat in my water....I asked the waiter for another drink and it took awhile to get one. He didn't apologize for the inconvenience. Food wasn't that great. Maybe it was an off day but I will not return to find out.

Came by here after work for a few beers, stayed for more than a few and enjoyed fried pickles and onion rings for the first time...the fried pickles that is.  It is a very nice spot - on an Wednesday night, it was an older crowd but worked out great because I came to talk bizniz and it wasn't all crazy or nothing.  The bartender/waitress were friendly and checked on us a few times.  I hadn't been to a true local bar, so it was my first time in one in Charlotte.  Everything about it was quite nice without anything overly awesome nor anything near bad at all.  Had fried pickles for the first time, didn't think they were particularly awesome, but went well with beer.  The onion rings however were perfect - enough onion to know you're eating it and the fried portion was simply splendid.  It stayed on the ring, wasn't too soft or brittle.  Definitely will want to make it out here again sometime soon.  dmo out.

Took my family here last night for dinner. They loved it ! Sister, brother-law and mom had crab cake sandwich. Seasoned really good. Crunchy fires and nice cold slaw too. Husband had good size burger. Father had fried shrimp very big and tasty. My husband and I shared peel eat shrimp. It was cold, fresh and tasty. I had Crab Nachos very good. A couple of us also had Shrimp Chowder very hot tasty with plenty of large shrimp. Great portions! I wanted to give 5 stars but service was bit too slow. Maybe next time it will be better. Plan to go back again real soon.

The she crab soup is absolutely amazing! Fantastic food and food came out fast. First time here and I will be here many more times. Can't wait to try more things they have to offer. Wanted to try the egg nog cake with ice cream but lunch had me stuffed. You will leave very happy with very well priced items and the food is superb and great service

Visiting from out of town and we ate here for brunch. Looks pretty simple as far as atmosphere and menu goes, but the food is delicious. Really surprising gem. One of my friends got the chicken and waffles- I think this is the brunch menu item to get! It was amazing. The pecan crust on the chicken paired perfectly with the waffles. All the food was delicious though. Cheap bloody marys too if that's your thing.
Great neighborhood spot. Been here for years. Good food and a friendly staff. Good place for breakfast or lunch. Always busy and food is fresh.

It's a Charlotte favorite but it does have its problems, the staff can really be moody, got our food at quarter till closing,it was so so but what got us, is they guit servicing alcohol right at closing, we still had food, we were confused considered some of the staff set down to have a beer, so the bar tender was still serving but not to paying customers, so don't go to late

Came on a Sunday around 3pm and there was no wait and very few people inside. For starters, we got the fried pickles which were the BEST fried pickles I have ever had. Honestly, I would go back just to get fried pickles and going to this restaurant is quite the drive for me. It was the perfect amount of crispy and the ranch was amazing!!   I got the chicken and waffles as the main dish with hash browns. The portions were huge and the butter was the best part! The hash browns were a little too crispy for me but the chicken and waffles were good! The chicken could have been seasoned a little more but I'm still a fan! I would definitely go back because I heard the grits were really good and of course for the pickles.

I have now been here for something other than breakfast and I still enjoy.  I have enjoyed this pace for a few lunches recently.  The service is usually pretty good.  There has been one or two times that the server was too busy to give the full attention I feel that should've been given, but oh well...it happens.  I have tried the she crab soup finally!  It was delicious!  I would suggest getting the larger size, because the price difference is not that big and it is well worth it.  The red bean nachos are good, however, the cheese is buried at the bottom, causing the nachos to get really soggy.  I would prefer if it were on top-next time I will request it this way.    I tasted my friend's chicken and waffles and OMG!  So good.  The chicken is perfectly crispy and I think it's pecan fried :).  They serve it with a cinnamon butter and maple syrup!!  It is melt in your mouth delicious-I can't get over how good this is.  It is a MUST try when coming here.

Can you say scrum de li ish cious without drooling over yourself after eating the salmon over spinach salad lunch special today at Eddie's. .Answer:  Absolutely #NOT. .what a treat what a feat and did I also mention the simply tasty creamy cup of had to be homemade chicken and noodle soup also on the lunch special menu too..If every restaurant had these specials no one would bring their lunch or skip their lunch. .let's just say mmm mmm good!  Just one more thing ok you got me 2 more things..the waiter Jarrett asked me how I wanted my salmon cooked..excuse me come again after I lift my chin off of the table..No Way..some seafood restaurants don't even ask that & for salmon over a salad come on..Very Impressive not to mention the portion size..OMG..winner winner salmon dinner size!!  All under the careful watchful attentive personable & highly accommodating service of the one & only Jarrett

Excellent place for an omelet.  Whether you order off the menu, or make your own, you will not be disappointed. The servers can help you craft a perfect omelet, always cooked to your specs. My favorite is the veggie omelet with feta, but hold the olives please.  For those of us that hate the chain/franchise restaurants, Eddie's is the place to go for a solid breakfast.

Eddie's place is a great example of no-frills, good cooking here in Charlotte. On the weekends you can expect a wait, but it moves quickly and you'll be happy you waited.   On this trip, I finally decided to try their she crab soup that everyone raves about. This, for me, was good, but at the same time, with every bite I was fishing out a shell. This isn't my first time with crab, and I know their shells can be difficult to find and peel, but I honestly just wasn't expecting to have to dig out a chunk of shell or two with every bite. As my mother would say, at least you know it's real crab, but at $6 a cup, I wanted to enjoy it rather than work for it.   I also got the Ruben sandwich, which was very tasty. It was traditional Ruben with the fixings, and the balance in each bite was delicious. I went with the veggies as my side, and they were a miss. Way too big of cuts, and had a freezer bag taste to them. My husband always gets their muffelata, and that is a large sandwich (you only need the half) and it's very tasty! Their olive spread they put on their might be the best salty/sour/olive bite you can have.

I don't often give 5 stars as I am pretty hard to please according to my family but this place deserves it. The she crab soup is excellent with lots of crab per soup full. The salads are huge and breakfast is great. I'll keep coming back.

One of the best breakfast spots in Charlotte!   Omelets are perfect and the hash browns are great.  Coffee is just ok, but the good will get your mind off of that.  Make sure to get the creole sauce on the side with your omelet, delicious addition!
Great for a diner-type breakfast. I've never had anything but. Good coffee. Great pancakes. Nothing fancy. Consistent.

Ok. Checked out a new church and now tried a new place to eat. Wasn't impressed. First, coffee wasn't as bad as other places, but I Still can't find a cup that doesn't taste like piss water. Waitress very nice. Place crowded. It was very cute and cozy, figured the food would be outta this world. Nope. Here's my problem. I ordered the special of Shrimp and grits with Tasso gravy. I asked what Tasso was and was told its like a spicy ham. Ok. I like a little spice. This shit was hawt!! !!  I should've been told that!! I almost Sent it back but I didn't feel like being an asshole after church, so I ate it. It's strange to say, but there was too much  shrimp and I felt bad it went to waste. There wasn't nearly enough cheese grits, which were delicious, btw. The shrimp were nicely fried in what I think was cornmeal. They were fresh and plump, probably 36/40 or smaller. My biscuit was big and fluffy. My friend was trying to eat healthy. So her dumb ass ordered egg white, hash browns  and turkey sausage. Hash browns looked undercooked, turkey overlooked. Egg whites looked fluffy. Overall, it was ok. I've had better. Probably won't be back unless I'm in the area. Nothing stood out for me.  What I had was good, if it wasn't so fuckin hot!

It's one of my best friend's 30th Birthday today and his favorite restaurant in Charlotte is Eddies. He was so excited to bring 5 of his best friends to eat at a place we had never been, and we were happy to stand outside and wait for a table even though it was chilly and rainy. The host, a tall skinny older man with glasses, took our name, and we waited outside, holding the door for every single patron that entered and exited for the next 30 minutes. At that time, we noticed that there were a much larger number of patrons going in than coming out. We walked in to find that every single party (there were 6 or 8 groups of people that had entered) had been seated and there were no open tables. The host said, "It doesn't look like things are working out in your favor today," and asked us if we had ever been to Leroy Fox, the restaurant next door. The birthday boy restated that it was his birthday and he had really hoped to eat there, and the host surveyed the dining room and pointed and said, "Well, it's going to be a while," and seated the people behind us that we had just held the door for 5 minutes prior. I've worked in the restaurant industry for 5 years and I've seen 16 year old girls do his job better than him, and they could do it while flirting with 30 year old servers and texting under the host stand. Eddies, find a new host/hostess!! We want your food!

Met my daughter here for dinner last night. It was pretty crowded but we still were seated right away. We couldn't decide on dinner or breakfast. They serve breakfast all day (A real + in my book). My daughter went with the cheese burger and I fell back on my favorite, french toast. What can I say, I'm a sucker for breakfast. My daughter's cheese burger looked great and must have tasted better because she polished it off along with most of the fries (she'd kill me if she knew I was writing this). The french toast was perfect! 4 thick pieces of french bread, cooked just right, with a little powdered sugar on top along with grits (cheese) and crispy bacon. Yum! Oh and the hostess was in a good mood tonight:)

Found this place on Yelp and decided to check it out since the reviews were good.  I went on a Sunday and this place was packed.  Be prepared to wait.  Since I was by myself the hostess recommended I put my name on the list at the bar.  My bartender Ben was a really nice guy and very personable.  He recommended one of the specials and I'm so glad he did.  It was delicious!  I ordered the Chilaquiles (traditional Mexican dish) with a side of liver mush.  I really enjoyed it and recommend everyone to try it! Now for the negative stuff.  Management needs to staff another person behind the bar during breakfast/brunch hours.  I waited about 15 minutes to even get a cup of coffee and then he gave me a menu.  Another 15 minutes go by for him to get my order.  So a total of 30 minutes from the time I sat down and finally ordered.  With the wait you guys had, you should have been flipping my seat ASAP.  It's not Ben's fault that he had no help, management is the one to blame.  The bartender does spend a little too much time talking to guest during a rush, but could you blame him as he has been neglecting tables?  He handled the whole bar, cashed out servers, ran food, took to-go orders, etc....I felt bad for the poor guy. I'll give it another try in a few months.

I love this place, but the review is honest. If my peniis got better with time, so can you guy's menu.  ==== FOOD =====  SHE-CRAB  For me the food is only "ok" at best. I tried the "she-crab" soup everyone rants & raves about and is on the menu's "Gotta try" list. Eh...wasn't memorable to me. Was fishy & came across way too many shell fragments. I am a seafood lover. I married a blowfish, for-crying-out-loud. What guy wouldn't?  SHRIMP -N GRITS  You're killing me guys. This is a simple dish. This is down South. If you can't cook good grits, leave them alone. The 'plain old good grits' factor is completely missing from this dish. The shrimp.....ugghh. ..come on guys...sautéing shrimp is not complicated business. Lightly season, marinate 30 minutes, pat that shit completely dry and toss in a hot oiled pan. Five minutes later, magic  What the hell is that red greasy crap you put in my grits? Chorizo? You guys really pissed me off with this dish, that's super simple to cook. Yall need one white or black Southern person cooking the local dishes. We ain't gotta wash 'em though! Hoo ahhh!  MAC 'N CHEESE W/ BACON   Sounds appetizing as hell right? Nope they dicked this up too. Possibly the greatest American comfort food, just ruined. Is it edible? Yep and that's it.  RUEBEN SANDWICH W/PASTA SALAD  Um...freaking delicious. Not the best I've had. I'm not used to it being served on square loaf bread but hey, it was pretty on point and the pasta salad with cubed veggies in a sweet/sour base was the perfect compliment. Recommended by Jesse. Thank you very much.  WINGS  Fried crispy without having to ask. Sauces? Pretty decent. Can't go wrong with the wings. A bar favorite and mine.  DRESSINGS   OMG. THEIR HOMEMADE DRESSINGS ARE SPECTACULAR. The first time I tried the blue cheese I accidentally punched this old broad off her stool. Not poop but seat.  FRIED PICKLES  Grrrrr...they're chips not spears. Grrrrr...Everyone knows spears are better. I mean, have you seen Britany's boobs? Balloontastic.  BREAKFAST   Never had it. Have heard everyone there brag about it. I asked Jesse what'd they serve. He said, 'Oh, regular breakfast stuff.' Lol. I believe they serve breakfast all day.  ======= DRINKS  AND PEOPLE =======  Why I come here. Ask Jesse to recommend you something. You won't regret it. What? The freaking  bartender stupid. God I really dig the people here, the way the bar is laid out. Always love outside seating of course. Jesse's a good guy. If you don't sit at the bar, you'll miss why people become regulars here. I'm really gonna miss this place when I leave Charlotte. Dammit.

Wait was a bit long for Sunday lunch (~30 minutes for 4 people) and they don't take call ahead, fyi. But once we were seated, the food was really good - no one disliked anything they got. As others have pointed out the Gouda Bacon Mac & Cheese is truly very "watery" (almost like soup consistency) but still tasty. And you can change things out or add or substitute pretty much anything, so that's great too. Shrimp & Grits were awesome, the Reuben was good but really greasy and needed more sauerkraut, the Breakfast Burrito was good, and the burger was just very average. We did have to flag down the hostess at one point to get some refills on water because our server was MIA for a little while during the meal. We were there for brunch, but they have weeknight dinner specials on the board over the bar, and a lot of them sounded really good. Bottom line, as long as you're not in a hurry this is a great little local gem, and we'll definitely be back to sample more items on the menu.

So this review is really on the food because our waitress was just ...awkward. But considering the guy that greeted us when we first sat down was so friendly and seemingly good at his job, I'm not going to downgrade this place for hiring an awkward but cute girl maybe less suitable for the gig than her predecessor.   Skipping straight to the food then...I was feeling soup and salad that day and my babe was craving breakfast food so this seemed like the perfect spot for the both of us to try. He got the chicken and waffles and I nabbed a bowl of the she crab soup everyone has been talking about and a side salad with ranch. As I think we can all agree the chicken and waffles were pretty dang delicious. The waffle had the perfect texture, the chicken delightfully crispy and the flavored butter on it was the perfect touch. The soup also proved to be a good choice. I tend to like a little more sherry flavor in my she crab but considering we are inland this was rather impressive tasting. The side salad was a little brown in places and was missing the spinach that the menu had promised but I cared a lot less about that once it was slathered in their scrumptious ranch.  Bookend this trip with another couple awkward encounters with our waitress to get our check paid and we STILL left the place satisfied.

Came in Sunday afternoon and had a great meal. Started with She crab soup(excellent).  For the meal, I ordered shrimp scampi with a side caesar salad. The shrimp were tasty cooked perfectly with a smooth sauce over the linguini. We also ordered a burger with cheese and mushrooms and onions. The burger was very juicy and had an excellent outdoor grilled flavor! The service was personable and she offered what I needed before I asked. I will come here again!

The food here was excellent and simply perfect for breakfast.  I would definitely suggest going here to eat some delicious hash browns, pancakes, and eggs.  Good coffee too. I just had a few problems with the environment and service.  I am usually all for alcohol with any meal, but they were being so pushy about having a bloody mary or a mamosa on a Sunday morning.  Eddie's Place is more a bar that happens to serve breakfast.  I just think it works better the other way around.  (See my Egg Heads review).  The price was reasonable and maybe I could give this place 4 stars, but would rate it a 3.9. I still say.. Enjoy and give it a try..  -Ian M.

Another entry in the best burger bracket in the Observer.  I stopped here on Saturday for lunch.  The restaurant was busy with several groups people waiting.  I managed to grab a spot at the bar.  Ben, the bartender was very friendly and took good care of me.  I order the burger which comes with one side.  I was going to get fries and then a side of onion rings.  Ben said they could do 1/2 fries & 1/2 onion rings as a side.  It took a long time to get my food, but the kitchen was doing a good job of keeping orders flowing.  When I got my burger the people sitting next to me at the bar said I should take a picture of it. It did look very good.  The burger is fresh not frozen and had the standard setup, lettuce, tomato, onions.  Ben let me know when I ordered that they could cook my burger any way I wanted.  I ordered medium rare and the burger was closer to rare, but that didn't matter.  it was juicy and tasty.  Both the fries and onion rings were fresh not frozen.  The onion rings were awesome.  At $11 for burger, frings (fries & onion rings) and a beer the price was right.  I'm definitely going to have to go there again as they have some nice breakfast items which they serve anytime.

2e recently moved to Charlotte and were in the area. I trusted Yelp and it was just as great as the reviews were. We had breakfast. I had the Waffle Breakfast! What ever you do say Yes to the Apple Cinnamon Butter with it! It was so good. My bf had the steak and eggs! Steak was a tad bit dry but would try it again! Service was great and on top of things. Host even open the door for us on the way out. They also have a full bar. Can't wait to go back!

Too loud, apathetic service, and subpar food. I had heard great things about this place for brunch/breakfast, but decided to give it a go for dinner. The waitress got the order wrong (no problem, mistakes happen), then seemed annoyed when kindly asked to fix the problem. The Reuben was too salty, soggy, and barely had any meat in it. Call me picky, but I expect a sandwich to look robust and filling. My dining partner's fries were overcooked with blackened ends. If the food and service wasn't bad enough the place was extremely loud. Literally had to speak loudly to hear each other across the table. Skip this place and go somewhere else.

We have frequented Eddie's Place several times over the last couple of years living in the neighborhood and I'm just now reviewing! Shame on me!  Eddie's is a wonderful spot to come in when you're feeling lazy and don't want to cook, but you want to remain casual with no fuss. The menu is plentiful, there is always a daily special AND (super bonus) there is all day breakfast available. The portions are generous and I've never left hungry. The staff have always been extremely attentive and kind and the restaurant is always clean. It is definitely a neighborhood spot where they know several customers by name and life story but the staff never fails to be warm to first comers as well.   It's silly but one of or favorite things about Eddie's is how crisp the salads always are. Cold plates, chilled lettuce and fresh toppings, and the habanero ranch is an addiction of mine. For those who like to have vegetarian options like myself, don't fret, the red beans and rice dish is one of my favorites here (without any meat added) and they have a black bean burger as well (which you can add avocado on top for just $1 extra).   Overall Eddie's is the perfect neighborhood go to and we have utilized it many times as such. It gets an A in our book with no complaints!

Ordered the chicken and waffles, overall they were amazing, only downside to eddies place was the wait time, took a while to get a seat, took even longer to get the food but what else do you expect on a Sunday morning...

REVIEW SOLEY BASED ON PICK UP: You would have to pay me to eat here. Mediocre food. First of all, corn beef hash in a can taste 10xs better than what they serve. My "old fashion hash browns" had store bought cheap cheese on top, how do I know? Cause I can see the squares of the Kraft cheese (bet it's not even kraft brand), guess not so old fashioned. Nachos are a miss for sure. AGAIN STORE BOUGHT salsa, definitely Tostitos brand. Red bean was bland. Only good review was tomaría and lettuce on nachos were good.

My friend and I came here for dinner on a Friday nigh after seeing the reviews on Yelp. She was particularly excited about the all day breakfast/brunch. There was no wait to be seated at around 6pm.   We ordered the creamy cajun pasta and their famous French toast. The Cajun pasta was ok, but the French toast was the best I've ever had. I would definitely come back just for those.

Eddies Place has the BEST burger in charlotte... the BEEEEEST. Its a great neighborhood joint... good food, good service and a great place for breakfast served any time of the day. Besides the burger they have excellent wings and the nachos are a must. For breakfast you cannot beat their french toast.

I had the pancakes, bacon and eggs. I didn't go too exotic but what I had was good. The bartender was excellent. It was very crowded. Not a bad place to stop into if you're in the area. It lacks a star because I wouldn't say it's anything super special.

I just wasn't overly impressed with this place.  I searched high and low for a great brunch place and Eddie's Place consistently popped up on the various lists.  I like the fact that it is older and a little hole in the wall type place.  That makes me feel like it is authentic and bound to be yummy!    We were there for brunch...I ordered the eggs benedict...I know a safe choice.  My friend ordered an omlet with hashbrowns.  The bacon in her omlet was chewy, not crispy.  The eggs were overcooked.  The hashbrowns were old school style, which were honestly a little bland.  The service was just so-so.  I know we didn't get overly creative with our orders but I guess that is part of why I only give this restaurant 3 stars.  I didn't find the menu to be that innovative.  I was hoping to see some great brunch/lunch items that would be unique to this place only.  NOT so much!  They had french toast but with cream cheese but even their specials for the day were not-so-special.    I don't know...maybe I am missing something.  Let me know what I should try next time to really be impressed and I will update my review.
Great place for French toast with bacon and cheesy grits. Was great.

Pancakes and Syrup! Pancakes and Syrup!  This place is easy and laid back. Breakfast all day!! Great for the kiddies and bar foods pretty darn good. Beers and Cocktails are flowing nicely too. There's a good bit of TVs to catch most big games and events and there service is prompt. I do enjoy this local place.
I regret not coming inn here sooner. I frequent the gallery next door. The food was amazing (especially the chicken & waffles) and the service was also. I'm excited to go back.

As some others have said, where have I been? After reading some reviews I decided to head to Eddie's this past Saturday for breakfast.  I arrived shortly after 11:00 and there was a line outside, which is always a good sign. I put my name in at the door, but was told if I wanted to sit at the counter I could put my name in their too, depending on what comes available first.  The counter was packed, but only one person ahead of me.  Within 10 minutes a spot came availbale and and Ben called me over.   The counter reminded me like Cheers, all usuals and Ben remembers everyone. He provided me with a menu, took my drink order and brought me a water.  I chose the Bloody Mary which was great and I proceeded to enjoy two! As for the food I ordered a three egg omelett, which allows for unlimited options.  I chose ham, peppers, onions, mushrooms and swiss which a side of parmesan cheese grits, hash browns and a biscuit.  The omelett was huge, but mainly egg, not a lot of veggies inside.  The hash browns were awesome with a nice crisp top and soft in the middle. As for the biscuit, not your typical biscuit, but served fresh, hot and to my liking.  I enjoyed the company at the counter and the service, as I said Ben and the staff are on top of things, and will definitely be back. I also though the April specials looked great so I might have to check out their dinners too!  Make sure your plan for a wait or be willing to jump in at the counter if a seat of two opens up, which I thought was the way to go.

Tried the she crab soup, pot stickers and Cajun chicken pasta. Pot stickers were average, they were what they were which was fine. The pasta was average, the chicken that accompanied it was slightly above average, not a ton of flavor on the sauce. The she crab soup stole the show, def will return to try the much raved about breakfast and take 2 bowls of soup to go.
First time here, came for the Shea crab soup!! Cozy,  kid friendly and good specials!
Gross food and horrible service. Waited 10 mins for a waitress to ask us what we want to drink. Nothing to eat if you're vegetarian, hell no if you're vegan. Not a single decent bite.

They are so cool at Eddie's Place. Most of the staff have been there for a while. They are very kind and engaging. They like to have a good time and still be professional. That is the way to go! I had the wings there with blue cheese( sorry I forgot to take a photo). I ordered my wings with a mixture of buffalo and bbq. They were jumbo and delicious. I only stopped by for a quick bite because I was about to get my kids from school... Always a great place to stop and inexpensive.

I know I have already posted about my exceptional experiences at Eddie's,  but it cant hurt to give it another great review. I have been frequenting Eddie's place a bit more lately and I have to say once again, amazing food, great service as always, and just a comfortable environment, it's a place where everyone knows your name. Branched out on my selections from the menu, and of course, I was very pleased with my new selections and their specials. I can not stress enough how amazing the staff is. I visit many restaraunts but this place is my go to neighborhood spot.  I would recommend this place to anyone that enjoys a laid back diner with all day breakfast as well as a very wide variety of delicious meals, as well as good drink and food specials. Once again, i can not express enough that the servers, bartenders, cooks and management do an absolute amazing job.

If you want a typical American breakfast, then this is the place for you! Everything tastes good in its most basic form. The reason why I gave it 4 stars is because I really enjoy trying different things. If you want something traditional then go here!
Nice service.   We sat at the bar.   Drinks ordered and came immediately.  Food came out quick, gumbo is FANTASTIC. And they have "not your fathers" rootbeer.  Definitely a great stop for lunch.

I was told about this place and decided to check it out. Glad I did! With only a 15min wait for a table (I could've Sat at the bar for faster service) but I have a good book and wanted to stretch my legs. Anyhoo, the waffle with homemade cinnamon butter was awesome. My belly is swollen with yummy goodness! Eggs scrambled with cheddar cheese, bacon and a side of hash browns w/onion. Mmm mmm good! The service was fast and efficient and my good was hot.

Yep, I'm giving Eddie's one more star! My mother and I were out shopping yesterday and I was craving soup and remembered Eddie's having an awarding winning she-crab soup.   We ordered two cups of soups and a pulled pork Cuban sandwich, sweet tea and I went for a PBR.   The soup came out first and let me tell you -- we were so happy at the fresh crab meat and savory thick broth... it was amazing. They also bring you some sherry wine to drizzle over it.. DE-LISH. I of course had to put some Tabasco in it... That will be a cold day/night go too!   Thank goodness we shared the sandwich, as it was HUGE. It was really good. The bread, pork, ham, cheese, pickle... yum a great version of a classic Cubano sandwich.   We ordered a bowl to go and had them wrap up our left over sandwich and made sure to feed my father! ha!   My mother stated she really preferred this establishment over Briggs as the ambiance is refreshing and casual and not sterile like Briggs...   So Eddie's it is again. Thank you for the yummy food and great prices! My mom laughed that my PBR was cheaper than her sweet tea. :)

Have been here before, great food. Went there this morning and was told there was a 20 minute wait, 30 minutes in a realized people that got there less than 10 minutes ago were being seated. I went inside and asked where we were in line and they told me I was next. Then three groups were seated after this. I left after this.

This is my favorite Restaurant in town!  Great Rueben and the she crab soup is a must.  I always sit at the bar because the bartender Ben is the best at his craft in Charlotte!  Even when he's slammed he greets you and goes ahead and grabs me my usual bud light. He goes above and beyond with his great service.  I just love this place and tell people about it all the time.  You gotta check out Eddie's Place!
SO DELICIOUS!! and some of the BEST customer service from our waiter Ben. I would highly recommend this place for  breakfast!!

My wife and I were looking for a place to have breakfast one morning and when we saw the number of cars in the parking lot around Eddie's we knew that this had to be a place to check out.  The place was crowded, everyone seemed happy and we headed to the bar which was a first come first serve section.  I had the French toast, side of bacon and hash browns which were pretty fantastic and my wife had an omelet which not only came out perfectly but made us want to come back here again.  One of the best parts of this experience was however, the breakfast and a show.  There was a little boy two seats down, maybe 7 or 8 who was having breakfast with his dad.  He also had the french toast but quickly cut it up into bite sized pieces, arranged them neatly around the edges of his oval shaped plate and then poured a pool of syrup in the middle.  One by one those pieces dove off the edge until the plate was finished, the little boy full and my wife and I completely entertained.  Now I can't promise he will be there every time you go to Eddie's but I can promise that breakfast will be good!

I found this place on Yelp reviews.  We are not at all familiar with the Charlotte area and we were looking for a non-chain breakfast place to meet up with our son who was driving up from South Carolina.  This place did not disappointment.  The food was delicious and had a flare that was different from your traditional diner breakfast fare.  For example, their french toast is prepared with Ciabatta bread as opposed to regular white bread.  One of my son's ordered the chicken and waffles and the portion was huge - in addition, you get to pick a side.  The portions were generous, the quality was delish and the price was reasonable.  Most important our server was attentive even though the place was busy with a line out the door.  Our food was served promptly and we didn't feel rushed to leave our table.  Will definitely use this as a regular meeting point in Charlotte.    PS. - if you are up late at night - they are open until 2pm and still serving a limited food menu.

Been wanting to try this little spot for a while & we finally made it a few weeks ago.  Won't be the last visit, that's for sure!  It was lunch time & they weren't very crowded (especially considering the area), but that turned out to be no indication of what to expect as I first thought.   The atmosphere is cool n local, with tons of photos,  memorabilia from schools, local sports teams & the like on the walls, and multiple large screens, each playing something different (no sound though).  The waiters/waitresses all have a very laid back, go-with-the-flow vibe about them which is great (laid back, but not lackadaisical).    The food was spot on, plentiful and tickled the taste buds.  And breakfast is always available! I ordered the turkey burger w/fries.  Loved it.  At first I was turned off by the appearance of a mass-produced pre-formed patty, but was a convert at first bite. Yum!  Toppings were plentiful and condiments were offered on the side, which I always love (I'm the world's pickiest picky person & like to control the amounts of mayo & such).  The fries were my only sticking point, but weren't awful by any stretch.  Just a little too oily & thick for my taste. The other half ordered a make-your-own omelet w/grits and toast.  Mmm mmm.  Sausage was cooked well and very flavorful, cheese was just gooey enough but not too much so, and the grits were the perfect consistency.  All-in-all Eddie's is a great little spot for any meal.  I do think they're a tad pricier than they should be for what they offer, but not so much so it prevents me from going back on a whim.  I already have a running list of things to try next time!

This place serves breakfast all day and great southern food.  I've been here a few times and gotten a steak sandwich marinated in coffee and brown sugar, a reueben and also french toast bignets.  All three were very tasty.   Good food, and good service.  I wish the TVs were a little bigger, they still have old school CRTs, but they have specials on beers every once in a while.  This week they are doing $1 PBR, $1.50 bud light/ miller lite.  Can't really go wrong with that. It's one of those great places where you know what you want, but at the same time, everything else still looks good so you have to kinda force yourself to stay with the first choice.

My mom actually found this place, I don't think I would have even spotted Eddie's place from the road. We've been here a few times now and always enjoyed it. I've only had the breakfast and it's good. Nothing too fancy, but they have a lot of options, simple eggs and bacon and even more fancy daily specials. After seeing a few of these reviews, I think I need to go try the Ruben soon.  The only issues to point out are, this place gets really busy on the weekend mornings. It's busy and not the most relaxing place. With that aside, this is a great little spot, good food and kind, speedy service.  I don't know of a similar type of restaurant close by. Definitely give it a try.
Gouda Mac and Cheese with chili. Delicious but ruined my diet for the day!! It's always nice to chat with the regulars as well.

This is my favorite place for Sunday brunch in all of Charlotte (however I've only been to about 4 or 5 places).  It doesn't hurt that it's right across from St. Gabe's and is still serving breakfast food when the 12:30 mass lets out at 1:45.  The wait is reasonable, the service is quick, and the food is great.  I like my eggs scrambled dry, and they always get them right, while by comparison I often have been disappointed by other places.  My worse complaint is that one morning I needed to send my bagel back twice before it was toasted sufficiently.

I took Virginia's recommendation with the chicken fried breakfast.  Great place for breakfast and when I come back for lunch or dinner I will update this. I don't think you can go wrong with anything you order the couple next to me are regulars and showed me everything that is good.

I've been coming here for over 10 years. I have never had a disappointing meal or experience here.   She-crab soup, bacon cheese fries and their whole breakfast menu are what I find myself ordering the most.

A couple good things.  A couple average things.  2 bad thing.  Let's start with the good. My meal was by the far the best and would make me come back.  Manhattan Clam Chowder was spicy, yet good.  My Creole with shrimp was fantastic.  5 stars.  The taste was perfect and the size was great.  They were very generous with the shrimp too !  Two people got burgers.  They were average burgers.  Which means they were good, however if you were wanting to go somewhere for just a burger this would not be the place.  The screw up though was the fries.  Over salty and just not good.  Some of the worst fries we have ever had.   I would come back for breakfast though!  And dinner--but recommend the entrees.

This is a nice little place for the locals to enjoy. I was seated as soon as I walked in the door. Our server (Chad) was very personable and attentive. As for the food.... It's love in the form of food! :-)   The Chicken and Waffles were wonderful and paired with some cheddar cheese grits, you're in for a food coma. The infamous "Ciabatta" French Toast was my poison. You can pick two or four, but trust me two is enough.  Did I mention, they serve breakfast ALL DAY! I encourage anyone that hasn't tried this place yet, to swing by and try it out... You will not be disappointed.
Been back for the mac an cheese twice. Not so good. Very dry. Cmon Eddie! Get it back together
